A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Spoiler FREE Review I don’t understand the backlash from the audience especially because of how hypocritical it is. Everyone complained about The Force Awakens being too familiar and derivative\, but got upset when they got what they wanted: something fresh and new. This film had the right balance of expanding and adding to the Star Wars mythos\, while remaining true to the franchise in the right places. This was classic Star Wars\, but also gave it the shake up the franchise needed. Although I thoroughly enjoyed the film\, it definitely has its flaws and isn’t at all perfect\, but there wasn’t a moment I didn’t have fun watching it. The comic relief was enjoyable and eased the tension of the drama in the right places. The plot was overall exciting. Some of the subplots and Laura Dern’s new character didn’t end up mattering that much to the main plot\, but the scenes for those subplots were still entertaining. There were a few disagreements I had with some choices for some scenes\, but none affected much of the story. At the end of the day\, I’d say it’s the third best Star Wars movie.
